member.name: T:MudBlazor.CategoryAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the name of the category in which to group the property of a MudBlazor component when displayed in the API documentation.
member.remarks:
Use this attribute together with the .
This attribute is similar to .
The name of the category can be specified by using a constant defined in the class.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.CategoryAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the category.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.CategoryAttribute.Order
member.summary: The order of the category - the greater the number the lower the category will be displayed in the API documentation.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.CategoryTypes
member.summary: Possible categories of MudBlazor components properties.

remarks.para:
- Data - Used e.g. in form fields, pickers, , , , , and . Containers have this group when their items can be defined not only in markup language, but also programmatically in the Items property and by specifying ItemTemplate.
- Validation - Used in form fields and pickers.
- Behavior - Changing these properties changes behavior of the component and behavior of the application. So in some way they are or may be more important than the "Appearance" category. Example properties are: a) the Disabled property, b) icons (or avatars) without default value (because setting their value can pass additional information).
- Appearance - Changing these properties doesn't change behavior of the component and behavior of the application, but only changes the appearance of the component irrelevant to the understanding of the application by a user. So in some way they are less important than the "Behavior" category, because they are only used to adjust the look of the application. Example properties are: a) Elevation, Outlined, Square, Rounded, Gutters, Dense, Ripple; b) size, color, and typography of the item and its subelements; c) CSS classes and styles of subelements; d) icons with the default value already set (because most often changing its value doesn't change passed information).
- Common - Properties defined in .

Note: The following properties belong to the "Behavior" group, not to the "Appearance" group:
- - because it describes meaning of the button, since MudIconButton doesn't have text,
- - because it describes meaning of the field,
- - because it can describe information important to a user, e.g. a numeric field unit such as kilograms.
Sometimes choosing a category can be difficult - in such case choose a category that makes the most sense.
remarks.b: Categories for specific behaviors or specific parts of components
remarks.para: If some elements or behaviors can be distinguished in a component, then their properties are included in separate groups.

Note: If a property qualifies for both the "Appearance" or "Behavior" group, and for some special group, then this special group takes precedence. For example, could belong to the "Appearance" group, but belongs to the "Editing" group.
The list of categories is inspired by the categories displayed for Windows Forms and Web Forms components in the Visual Studio "Properties" window.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudFormComponent`2.Touched
member.summary: Indicates whether the user has interacted with this input or the focus has been released.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. When true, the user has performed input, or focus has moved away from this input. This property is typically used to show the text only after the user has interacted with this input.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudFormComponent`2.ValidationErrors
member.summary: The list of problems with the current input value.
member.remarks: When using a , this property is updated when validation has been performed. Use the property to control what validations are performed.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudFormComponent`2.Validation
member.summary: The function used to detect problems with the input.
member.remarks:
When using a , this property can be any of several kinds of functions:
1. A Func<T,bool> or Func<T,Task<bool>> function. Returns true if valid. When false, a standard "Invalid" message is shown.
2. A Func<T,string> or Func<T,Task<string>> function. Returns null if valid, or a string explaining the error.
3. A Func<T,IEnumerable<string>> or Func<T,Task<IEnumerable<string>>> function. Returns an empty list if valid, or a list of validation errors.
3. A Func<object,string,IEnumerable<string>> or Func<object,string,Task<IEnumerable<string>>> function. Given the form model and path to the member, returns an empty list if valid, or a list of validation errors.
4. A object.

member.summary: The function used to search for items.
member.remarks: This function searches for items containing the specified string value, and returns items which match up to the property. You can use the provided which is marked as canceled when the user changes the search text or selects a value from the list.

member.summary: The maximum number of items to display.

member.summary: The minimum number of characters typed to initiate a search.

member.summary: Reset the selected value if the user deletes the text.

member.summary: Highlights the text when the component receives focus.
member.remarks: Defaults to true. Previously known as SelectOnClick.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudAutocomplete`1.Strict
member.summary: Selects items without resetting the Value.
member.remarks: Defaults to true. When true, selecting an option will trigger a with the current Text. Otherwise, an empty string is passed which can make it easier to view and select other options without resetting the Value. When false, T must either be a record or override the GetHashCode and Equals methods.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudAutocomplete`1.DebounceInterval
member.summary: The debounce interval, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: Defaults to 100. A higher value can help reduce the number of calls to , which can improve responsiveness.

member.summary: The custom template used to display unselected items.

member.summary: The custom template used for the progress indicator inside the popover when is true.

member.summary: Overrides the Text property when an item is selected.

member.summary: Sets the Value property even if no match is found by .

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudForm.Validation
member.summary: The default function or attribute used to validate form components which cannot validate themselves.
member.remarks:
Supported values are:
1. A Func<T,bool> or Func<T,Task<bool>> function. Returns true if valid. When false, a standard "Invalid" message is shown.
2. A Func<T,string> or Func<T,Task<string>> function. Returns null if valid, or a string explaining the error.
3. A Func<T,IEnumerable<string>> or Func<T,Task<IEnumerable<string>>> function. Returns an empty list if valid, or a list of validation errors.
3. A Func<object,string,IEnumerable<string>> or Func<object,string,Task<IEnumerable<string>>> function. Given the form model and path to the member, returns an empty list if valid, or a list of validation errors.
4. A object.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.MudIcon.IconSyntax.SlashContentRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^(.+?)/(.+)$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
1st capture group.
Match a character other than '\n' lazily at least once.
Match '/'.
2nd capture group.
Match a character other than '\n' greedily at least once.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

summary.para: The pattern attribute, when specified, is a regular expression which the input's value must match in order for the value to pass constraint validation. It must be a valid JavaScript regular expression Defaults to [0-9,.\-] To get a numerical keyboard on safari, use the pattern. The default pattern should achieve numerical keyboard.
Note: this pattern is also used to prevent all input except numbers and allowed characters. So for instance to allow only numbers, no signs and no commas you might change it to [0-9.]

member.name: M:MudBlazor.MudPicker`1.HandleKeyDown(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs)
member.summary: 'HandleKeyDown' needed to be async in order to call other async methods. Because the HandleKeyDown is virtual and the base needs to be called from overriden methods we can't use 'async void'. This would break the synchronous behavior of those overriden methods. The KeyInterceptor does not support async behavior, so we have to add this hook method for handling the KeyDown event. This method can be removed when the KeyInterceptor supports async behavior.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudTableBase.IsEditRowSwitchingBlocked
member.summary: Forces a row being edited to be saved or canceled before a new row can be selected.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudTableBase.SortLabel

member.summary: Allows a sort direction of in addition to and .

member.name: T:MudBlazor.InputMode
member.summary: The inputmode global attribute is an enumerated attribute that hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. Not supported by safari. Use Pattern to achieve special mobile keyboards in safari. https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.none
member.summary: No virtual keyboard. For when the page implements its own keyboard input control. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.text
member.summary: Default. Standard input keyboard for the user's current locale. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.decimal
member.summary: Fractional numeric input keyboard containing the digits and decimal separator for the user's locale (typically . or ,). Devices may or may not show a minus key (-). Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.numeric
member.summary: Numeric input keyboard, but only requires the digits 09. Devices may or may not show a minus key. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.tel
member.summary: A telephone keypad input, including the digits 09, the asterisk (*), and the pound (#) key. Inputs that require a telephone number should typically use <input type="tel">instead. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.search
member.summary: A virtual keyboard optimized for search input. For instance, the return/submit key may be labeled Search, along with possible other optimizations. Inputs that require a search query should typically use <input type="search"> instead. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.email
member.summary: A virtual keyboard optimized for entering email addresses. Typically includes the @ character as well as other optimizations. Inputs that require email addresses should typically use <input type="email"> instead. Reference

member.name: F:MudBlazor.InputMode.url
member.summary: A keypad optimized for entering URLs. This may have the / key more prominent, for example. Enhanced features could include history access and so on. Inputs that require a URL should typically use <input type="url"> instead. Reference

member.name: T:MudBlazor.ObjectFit
member.summary: Indicates how an object is sized relative to its container.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.ObjectFit.None
member.summary: The image is cropped to fit within its container.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.ObjectFit.Cover
member.summary: The content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the container.
member.remarks: If the object's aspect ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its container, then the object will be clipped to fit.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.ObjectFit.Contain
member.summary: The content is scaled to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the container.
member.remarks: The object is scaled to fill the container, while preserving its aspect ratio, which may cause a "letterbox" if its aspect ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its container.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.ObjectFit.Fill
member.summary: The content is sized to fill the container.
member.remarks: The object will completely fill the container. If the object's aspect ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its container, then the object will be stretched to fit.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.ObjectFit.ScaleDown
member.summary: The content is sized as if or were specified, whichever would result in a smaller object size.

member.summary: The component's top-left corner is at the container's top-left corner.
member.remarks: For transform origins, the component displays down and to the right of the anchor origin.

member.summary: The component is centered on the container's top center.

member.remarks: For transform origins, the component displays to the left of the anchor origin.

member.remarks: For transform origins, the component displays up and to the right of the anchor origin.

member.remarks: For transform origins, the component is centered above the anchor origin.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.Wrap
member.summary: The flex-wrap CSS property sets whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines. If wrapping is allowed, it sets the direction that lines are stacked.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Wrap.NoWrap
member.summary: This is the default value. The flex items are laid out in a single line which may cause the flex container to overflow. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending on the flex-direction value.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Wrap.Wrap
member.summary: The flex items break into multiple lines. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending flex-direction value and the cross-end is the opposite of the specified cross-start.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Wrap.WrapReverse
member.summary: Behaves the same as wrap but cross-start and cross-end are permuted.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Services.ResizeOptions.NotifyOnBreakpointOnly
member.summary: If true, RaiseOnResized is called only when breakpoint has changed. Default value is true.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Services.ResizeOptions.BreakpointDefinitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the breakpoint definitions, representing specific breakpoints and their associated width.
member.value: A dictionary where each entry represents a breakpoint, and the corresponding int value represents the width.
member.remarks: When the dictionary is null or empty, the default breakpoint definitions will be used. The default breakpoint definitions are as follows: [Breakpoint.Xxl] = 2560, [Breakpoint.Xl] = 1920, [Breakpoint.Lg] = 1280, [Breakpoint.Md] = 960, [Breakpoint.Sm] = 600, [Breakpoint.Xs] = 0.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Services.KeyInterceptorOptions.Keys
member.summary: Intercept configuration for keys of interest

summary.para: Configuration for preventDefault() and stopPropagation() control
For PreventDown, PreventUp, StopDown and StopUp the configuration which key combinations should match is a Javascript boolean expression.
Examples: For the examples, let's assume the Tab key was pressed. Note: for combinations of more than one modifier the following order of modifiers must be followed strictly: shift+ctrl+alt+meta

* Don't prevent key down: PreventDown=null or PreventDown="none" * Prevent key down of unmodified keystrokes such as "Tab": PreventDown="key+none" * Prevent key down of Tab and Ctrl+Tab PreventDown="key+none|key+ctrl" * Prevent key down of just Ctrl+Tab PreventDown="key+ctrl" * Prevent key down of Ctrl+Tab and Shift+Tab but not Shift+Ctrl+Tab: PreventDown="key+shift|key+ctrl" * Prevent key down of Shift+Ctrl+Tab and Ctrl+Tab but not Shift+Tab: PreventDown="key+shift+ctrl|key+ctrl" * Prevent any combination of key and modifiers, but not the unmodified key: PreventDown="key+any" * Prevent any combination of key and modifiers, even the unmodified key: PreventDown="any"
Examples: " " for space, "Tab" for tab, "a" for lowercase A-key. Also allowed: JS regex such as "/[a-z]/" or "/a|b/" but NOT "/[a-z]/g" or "/[a-z]/i" regex must be enclosed in two forward slashes!

member.summary: Options for the constructors

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Utilities.AsyncKeyedLock.AsyncKeyedLockOptions.MaxCount
member.summary: The maximum number of requests for the semaphore that can be granted concurrently. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Utilities.AsyncKeyedLock.AsyncKeyedLockOptions.PoolSize
member.summary: The size of the pool to use in order for generated objects to be reused. This is NOT a concurrency limit, but if the pool is empty then a new object will be created rather than waiting for an object to return to the pool. Defaults to 0 (disabled) but strongly recommended to use.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Utilities.AsyncKeyedLock.AsyncKeyedLockOptions.PoolInitialFill
member.summary: The number of items to fill the pool with during initialization. Defaults to -1 (fill up to pool size).

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.AsyncKeyedLock.AsyncKeyedLockOptions.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes options for the constructors
member.param: The maximum number of requests for the semaphore that can be granted concurrently. Defaults to 1.

The size of the pool to use in order for generated objects to be reused. This is NOT a concurrency limit, but if the pool is empty then a new object will be created rather than waiting for an object to return to the pool. Defaults to 0 (disabled) but strongly recommended to use.
The number of items to fill the pool with during initialization. Defaults to -1 (fill up to pool size).

member.name: T:MudBlazor.Utilities.Background.BackgroundWorkerBase
member.summary: Base class for implementing a long-running background worker.
member.remarks: This class provides a base implementation for executing asynchronous operations continuously or periodically in a background worker. It simplifies the implementation of scenarios where you need to execute asynchronous operations in the background. It also provides built-in support for graceful shutdown.

member.summary: Gets the Task that executes the background operation.
member.remarks: Will return if the background operation hasn't started.

member.summary: Starts the processing asynchronously. The implementation should return a task that represents the lifetime of the long running operation(s) being performed.
member.param: Indicates that the shutdown process should no longer be graceful.
member.returns: A that represents the long running operations.

member.summary: Triggered when the application host is ready to start the service.
member.param: Indicates that the start process has been aborted.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous Start operation.

member.summary: Triggered when the application host is performing a graceful shutdown.
member.param: Indicates that the shutdown process should no longer be graceful.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous Stop operation.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.Utilities.Debounce.DebounceDispatcher
member.summary: The Debounce dispatcher delays the invocation of an action until a predetermined interval has elapsed since the last call. This ensures that the action is only invoked once after the calls have stopped for the specified duration.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.Debounce.DebounceDispatcher.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified interval.
member.param: The minimum interval in milliseconds between invocations of the debounced function.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.Debounce.DebounceDispatcher.DebounceAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Debounce the execution of asynchronous tasks. Ensures that a function is invoked only once within a specified interval, even if multiple invocations are requested.
member.remarks: This implementation will swallow any exceptions that is thrown by the invoked task.
member.param: The function that returns a Task to be invoked asynchronously.
An optional CancellationToken.
member.returns: A Task representing the asynchronous operation with minimal delay.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.Utilities.Throttle.ThrottleDispatcher
member.summary: Utility class for throttling the execution of asynchronous tasks. It limits the rate at which a function can be invoked based on a specified interval.
member.remarks: Throttling ensures that a function is invoked no more than once within a defined time interval, regardless of how many times it is called.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.Throttle.ThrottleDispatcher.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified parameters.
member.param: The minimum interval in milliseconds between invocations of the throttled function.
If true, the interval is calculated from the end of the previous task execution; otherwise, from the start.
If true, the interval is reset when an exception occurs during the execution of the throttled function.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.Throttle.ThrottleDispatcher.ShouldWait
member.summary: Determines whether the current invocation should wait based on the configured interval.
member.returns: True if waiting is required; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.Utilities.Throttle.ThrottleDispatcher.ThrottleAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Throttles the invocation of the provided function asynchronously.
member.param: The function returning a Task to be invoked asynchronously.
An optional CancellationToken.
member.returns: The Task representing the asynchronous operation of the last executed function.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.Breakpoint
member.summary: Indicates a browser width used to trigger behaviors.
member.remarks: Breakpoints are typically used to show or hide content based on the width of the browser window, such as customizing content for desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Xs
member.summary: A small to large phone.
member.remarks: 600 pixels wide or less.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Sm
member.summary: A small to medium tablet.
member.remarks: Between 600 and 960 pixels wide.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Md
member.summary: A large tablet or laptop.
member.remarks: Between 960 and 1280 pixels wide.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Lg
member.summary: A desktop computer.
member.remarks: Between 1280 and 1920 pixels wide.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Xl
member.summary: A high-definition or 4K desktop computer monitor.
member.remarks: Between 1920 and 2560 pixels wide.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.Xxl
member.summary: An ultra-wide of 4K+ desktop computer monitor.
member.remarks: 2560 or more pixels wide.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.SmAndDown
member.summary: A small to medium tablet, or smaller device.
member.remarks: 960 pixels wide, or less.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.MdAndDown
member.summary: A large tablet, laptop, tablet, or smaller device.
member.remarks: 1280 pixels wide, or less.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.LgAndDown
member.summary: A desktop computer or smaller device.
member.remarks: 1920 pixels wide, or less.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.XlAndDown
member.summary: A high-definition or 4K desktop computer monitor, or smaller device.
member.remarks: 2560 pixels wide, or less.

member.remarks: 600 pixels wide, or more.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Breakpoint.MdAndUp
member.summary: A large tablet, laptop, or larger device.
member.remarks: 960 pixels wide, or more.

member.summary: Subscribes an observer to receive notifications of browser window size changes and breakpoints.
member.param: The observer to subscribe.

Indicates whether the event will fire immediately with the current and information without waiting for changes. When set to true, the event will be fired immediately. When set to false, it will wait for the service to observe any changes before firing the event. The event won't fire if such already exist, for example when you re-subscribe.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

After you pass the options, modifying the instance won't have any effect, including re-subscription, as C# and JS side doesn't support this, you need to and subscribe again.

member.summary: Listing to a javascript event

The value of the id field of the DOM element
The name of a JS function (relative to window) that used to project the event before it is send back to .NET. Can be null, if no projection is needed
The delay between the last time the event occurred and the callback is fired. Set to zero, if no delay is requested

The delay between the last time the event occurred and the callback is fired. Set to zero, if no delay is requested

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudGlobal.UnhandledExceptionHandler
member.summary: Global unhandled exception handler for such exceptions which can not be bubbled up. Note: this is not a global catch-all. It just allows the user to handle such exceptions which were suppressed inside MudBlazor using Task.AndForget() in places where it is impossible to await the task. Exceptions in user code or in razor files will still crash your app if you are not carefully handling everything with .

member.name: F:MudBlazor.MudGlobal.EnableIllegalRazorParameterDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether old parameters that were renamed in v7.0.0 should cause a runtime exception.
member.remarks: Razor silently ignores parameters which don't exist. Since v7.0.0 renamed so many parameters we want to help our users find old parameters they missed by throwing a runtime exception.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.PopoverOptions.PoolSize
member.summary:
The size of the pool to use in order for generated objects to be reused. This is NOT a concurrency limit, but if the pool is empty then a new object will be created rather than waiting for an object to return to the pool. Defaults to 3000.
NB! This setting is ignored in .
member.remarks: For more info please visit: AsyncKeyedLocker.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.PopoverOptions.PoolInitialFill
member.summary:
The number of items to fill the pool with during initialization. Defaults to 100.
NB! This setting is ignored in .
member.remarks: For more info please visit: AsyncKeyedLocker.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.State.ParameterMetadata.HandlerName
member.summary: Gets the unique name of the handler.
member.remarks: This is used to identify the handler uniquely. A null value indicates that the handler is always unique and typically means the usage of an anonymous function (lambda expression) as the handler instead of a method group. If two handlers have the same name, they are considered identical; otherwise, they are considered distinct.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.State.ParameterScopeContainer.ForceParametersAttachment
member.summary: Forces the attachment of the collection of immediately and initializes the inner dictionary.
member.remarks: This method is designed for performance optimization. By calling this method, the dictionary initialization is done immediately instead of waiting for the Blazor lifecycle to access the values. This helps avoid potential slowdowns in rendering speed that could occur if the dictionary were initialized during the Blazor lifecycle.

Creates a object which automatically manages parameter value changes as part of MudBlazor's ParameterState framework.

member.name: T:MudBlazor.EventUtil
member.summary: Utility class for opting out of rerendering in Blazor when an EventCallback is invoked. By default, components inherit from ComponentBase, which automatically invokes StateHasChanged after the component's event handlers are invoked. In some cases, it might be unnecessary or undesirable to trigger a rerender after an event handler is invoked. For example, an event handler might not modify the component state. https://learn.microsoft.com/aspnet/core/blazor/performance?view=aspnetcore-6.0#avoid-rerendering-after-handling-events-without-state-changes

member.returns: A non-rendering event handler.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.DateMask.ModifyFinalText(System.String)
member.summary: Note: this is required for special cases where the date becomes invalid after the last character has been input For instance: MM/dd/yyyy from 02/29/000| to 02/29/0001| The year 0001 is not a leap year so the day needs to be corrected to 28 Or this 0[3]/31/2000 input "4" => 04/31/2000 But we do this only for a complete date!

member.name: M:MudBlazor.DateMask.ValidDigitRegularExpression
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^\\d+$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a Unicode digit atomically at least once.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.summary: Return the Text without Placeholders. If CleanDelimiters is enabled, then also strip all undefined characters. For instance, for a mask "0000 0000 0000 0000" the space would be an undefined character (a delimiter) unless it were defined as a mask character in MaskChars.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.RegexMask.WhiteSpaceFilter
member.summary: Add this filter to the end of a mask to block any space, tab or newline character.

member.name: M:MudBlazor.RegexMask.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a mask that uses a regex to restrict input.
member.param:
The general or progressive regex to be used for input checking.
Note: a general regex must match every possible input, i.e. ^[0-9]+$. Note: a progressive regex must match even partial input successfully! The progressive regex must start with ^ and end with $ to work correctly!
Example: to match input "abc" a progressive regex must match "a" or "ab" or "abc". The progressive regex would look like this: ^a(b(c)?)?$ or like this ^(a|ab|abc)$ It is best to generate the progressive regex automatically like BlockMask does.

The mask defining the structure of the accepted input.
Note: if not included the regex will be the mask.

member.summary: Optional delimiter chars which will be jumped over if the caret is in front of one and the user inputs the next non-delimiter

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudContainer.Fixed
member.summary: Set the max-width to match the min-width of the current breakpoint. This is useful if you'd prefer to design for a fixed set of sizes instead of trying to accommodate a fully fluid viewport. It's fluid by default.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudContainer.MaxWidth
member.summary: Determine the max-width of the container. The container width grows with the size of the screen. Set to false to disable maxWidth.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudContainer.Gutters
member.summary: Adds left and right padding to the container itself.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.MudTabPanel.TabWrapperContent
member.summary: Tab content wrapper of component. It is used to wrap the content of a tab heading in a user supplied div or component. Use @context in the TabWrapperContent to render the tab header within your custom wrapper. This is most useful with tooltips, which must wrap the entire content they refer to.

member.summary: TabPanel Tooltip. It will be ignored if TabContent is provided.
